ElfFileHeader.C

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /* ELF File Header (SgAsmElfFileHeader and related classes) */
00002 
00003 #include "sage3basic.h"
00004 
00010 void
00011 SgAsmElfFileHeader::ctor()
00012 {
00013     ROSE_ASSERT(get_file()!=NULL);
00014     ROSE_ASSERT(get_size()>0);
00015 
00016     set_name(new SgAsmBasicString("ELF File Header"));
00017     set_synthesized(true);
00018     set_purpose(SP_HEADER);
00019 
00020     /* Magic number */
00021     p_magic.clear();
00022     p_magic.push_back(0x7f);
00023     p_magic.push_back('E');
00024     p_magic.push_back('L');
00025     p_magic.push_back('F');
00026 
00027     /* Executable Format */
00028     ROSE_ASSERT(p_exec_format!=NULL);
00029     p_exec_format->set_family(FAMILY_ELF);
00030     p_exec_format->set_purpose(PURPOSE_EXECUTABLE);
00031     p_exec_format->set_sex(ORDER_LSB);
00032     p_exec_format->set_word_size(4);
00033     p_exec_format->set_version(1);
00034     p_exec_format->set_is_current_version(true);
00035     p_exec_format->set_abi(ABI_UNSPECIFIED);
00036     p_exec_format->set_abi_version(0);
00037 
00038     p_isa = ISA_IA32_386;
00039     p_e_ident_data_encoding = 1;  /*LSB*/
00040     p_e_ident_padding = SgUnsignedCharList(9, '\0');
00041 }
00042 
00044 bool
00045 SgAsmElfFileHeader::is_ELF(SgAsmGenericFile *file)
00046 {
00047     /* Turn off byte reference tracking for the duration of this function. We don't want our testing the file contents to
00048      * affect the list of bytes that we've already referenced or which we might reference later. */
00049     bool was_tracking = file->get_tracking_references();
00050     file->set_tracking_references(false);
00051 
00052     try {
00053         unsigned char magic[4];
00054         file->read_content(0, magic, sizeof magic);
00055         if (0x7f!=magic[0] || 'E'!=magic[1] || 'L'!=magic[2] || 'F'!=magic[3])
00056             throw 1;
00057     } catch (...) {
00058         file->set_tracking_references(was_tracking);
00059         return false;
00060     }
00061     file->set_tracking_references(was_tracking);
00062     return true;
00063 }
00064 
00066 SgAsmExecutableFileFormat::InsSetArchitecture
00067 SgAsmElfFileHeader::machine_to_isa(unsigned machine) const
00068 {
00069     switch (p_e_machine) {                                /* These come from the Portable Formats Specification v1.1 */
00070       case 0:        return ISA_UNSPECIFIED;
00071       case 1:        return ISA_ATT_WE_32100;
00072       case 2:        return ISA_SPARC_Family;
00073       case 3:        return ISA_IA32_386;
00074       case 4:        return ISA_M68K_Family;
00075       case 5:        return ISA_M88K_Family;
00076       case 7:        return ISA_I860_Family;
00077       case 8:        return ISA_MIPS_Family;
00078       case 20:
00079         // Note that PowerPC has: p_e_machine = 20 = 0x14, using both gcc on BGL and xlc on BGL.
00080         // However, these don't seem like correct values for PowerPC.
00081         return ISA_PowerPC;
00082       case 40:       return ISA_ARM_Family;
00083       case 62:       return ISA_X8664_Family;
00084       default:
00085         /*FIXME: There's a whole lot more. See Dan's Elf reader. */
00086         // DQ (10/12/2008): Need more information to address PowerPC support.
00087         fprintf(stderr, "Warning: SgAsmElfFileHeader::parse::p_e_machine = 0x%lx (%lu)\n", p_e_machine, p_e_machine);
00088         return ISA_OTHER;
00089     }
00090 }
00091 
00093 unsigned
00094 SgAsmElfFileHeader::isa_to_machine(SgAsmExecutableFileFormat::InsSetArchitecture isa) const
00095 {
00096     switch (isa) {
00097       case ISA_UNSPECIFIED:
00098       case ISA_OTHER:        return p_e_machine;
00099       case ISA_ATT_WE_32100: return 1;
00100       case ISA_IA32_386:     return 3;
00101       case ISA_PowerPC:      return 20;  /*see note in machine_to_isa()*/
00102       default:
00103         switch (isa & ISA_FAMILY_MASK) {
00104           case ISA_SPARC_Family: return 2;
00105           case ISA_M68K_Family:  return 4;
00106           case ISA_M88K_Family:  return 5;
00107           case ISA_I860_Family:  return 7;
00108           case ISA_MIPS_Family:  return 8;
00109           case ISA_ARM_Family:   return 40;
00110           case ISA_X8664_Family: return 62;
00111           default:
00112             return p_e_machine;
00113         }
00114     }
00115 }
00116 
00121 SgAsmElfFileHeader*
00122 SgAsmElfFileHeader::parse()
00123 {
00124     SgAsmGenericHeader::parse();
00125 
00126     /* Read 32-bit header for now. Might need to re-read as 64-bit later. */
00127     Elf32FileHeader_disk disk32;
00128     if (sizeof(disk32)>get_size())
00129         extend(sizeof(disk32)-get_size());
00130     read_content_local(0, &disk32, sizeof disk32, false); /*zero pad if we read EOF*/
00131 
00132     /* Check magic number early */
00133     if (disk32.e_ident_magic[0]!=0x7f || disk32.e_ident_magic[1]!='E' ||
00134         disk32.e_ident_magic[2]!='L'  || disk32.e_ident_magic[3]!='F')
00135         throw FormatError("Bad ELF magic number");
00136 
00137     /* File byte order should be 1 or 2. However, we've seen at least one example that left the byte order at zero, implying
00138      * that it was the native order. We don't have the luxury of decoding the file on the native machine, so in that case we
00139      * try to infer the byte order by looking at one of the other multi-byte fields of the file. */
00140     ByteOrder sex;
00141     if (1 == disk32.e_ident_data_encoding) {
00142         sex = ORDER_LSB;
00143     } else if (2==disk32.e_ident_data_encoding) {
00144         sex = ORDER_MSB;
00145     } else if ((disk32.e_type & 0xff00)==0xff00) {
00146         /* One of the 0xffxx processor-specific flags in native order */
00147         if ((disk32.e_type & 0x00ff)==0xff)
00148             throw FormatError("invalid ELF header byte order"); /*ambiguous*/
00149         sex = host_order();
00150     } else if ((disk32.e_type & 0x00ff)==0x00ff) {
00151         /* One of the 0xffxx processor specific orders in reverse native order */
00152         sex = host_order()==ORDER_LSB ? ORDER_MSB : ORDER_LSB;
00153     } else if ((disk32.e_type & 0xff00)==0) {
00154         /* One of the low-valued file types in native order */
00155         if ((disk32.e_type & 0x00ff)==0)
00156             throw FormatError("invalid ELF header byte order"); /*ambiguous*/
00157         sex = host_order();
00158     } else if ((disk32.e_type & 0x00ff)==0) {
00159         /* One of the low-valued file types in reverse native order */
00160         sex = host_order() == ORDER_LSB ? ORDER_MSB : ORDER_LSB;
00161     } else {
00162         /* Ambiguous order */
00163         throw FormatError("invalid ELF header byte order");
00164     }
00165     ROSE_ASSERT(p_exec_format != NULL);
00166     p_exec_format->set_sex(sex);
00167     p_e_ident_data_encoding = disk32.e_ident_data_encoding; /*save original value*/
00168 
00169     /* Decode header to native format */
00170     rose_rva_t entry_rva, sectab_rva, segtab_rva;
00171     if (1 == disk32.e_ident_file_class) {
00172         p_exec_format->set_word_size(4);
00173 
00174         p_e_ident_padding.clear();
00175         for (size_t i=0; i<sizeof(disk32.e_ident_padding); i++)
00176              p_e_ident_padding.push_back(disk32.e_ident_padding[i]);
00177 
00178         p_e_ident_file_class    = disk_to_host(sex, disk32.e_ident_file_class);
00179         p_e_ident_file_version  = disk_to_host(sex, disk32.e_ident_file_version);
00180         p_e_type                = disk_to_host(sex, disk32.e_type);
00181         p_e_machine             = disk_to_host(sex, disk32.e_machine);
00182         p_exec_format->set_version(disk_to_host(sex, disk32.e_version));
00183         entry_rva               = disk_to_host(sex, disk32.e_entry);
00184         segtab_rva              = disk_to_host(sex, disk32.e_phoff);
00185         sectab_rva              = disk_to_host(sex, disk32.e_shoff);
00186         p_e_flags               = disk_to_host(sex, disk32.e_flags);
00187         p_e_ehsize              = disk_to_host(sex, disk32.e_ehsize);
00188 
00189         p_e_phnum               = disk_to_host(sex, disk32.e_phnum);
00190         if (p_e_phnum>0) {
00191             p_phextrasz         = disk_to_host(sex, disk32.e_phentsize);
00192             ROSE_ASSERT(p_phextrasz>=sizeof(SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry::Elf32SegmentTableEntry_disk));
00193             p_phextrasz -= sizeof(SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry::Elf32SegmentTableEntry_disk);
00194         } else {
00195             p_phextrasz = 0;
00196         }
00197 
00198         p_e_shnum               = disk_to_host(sex, disk32.e_shnum);
00199         if (p_e_shnum>0) {
00200             p_shextrasz         = disk_to_host(sex, disk32.e_shentsize);
00201             ROSE_ASSERT(p_shextrasz>=sizeof(SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry::Elf32SectionTableEntry_disk));
00202             p_shextrasz -= sizeof(SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry::Elf32SectionTableEntry_disk);
00203         } else {
00204             p_shextrasz = 0;
00205         }
00206 
00207         p_e_shstrndx            = disk_to_host(sex, disk32.e_shstrndx);
00208     } else if (2 == disk32.e_ident_file_class) {
00209         /* We guessed wrong. This is a 64-bit header, not 32-bit. */
00210         p_exec_format->set_word_size(8);
00211         Elf64FileHeader_disk disk64;
00212         if (sizeof(disk64)>get_size())
00213             extend(sizeof(disk64)-get_size());
00214         read_content_local(0, &disk64, sizeof disk64, false); /*zero pad at EOF*/
00215 
00216         p_e_ident_padding.clear();
00217         for (size_t i=0; i<sizeof(disk64.e_ident_padding); i++)
00218              p_e_ident_padding.push_back(disk64.e_ident_padding[i]);
00219 
00220         p_e_ident_file_class    = disk_to_host(sex, disk64.e_ident_file_class);
00221         p_e_ident_file_version  = disk_to_host(sex, disk64.e_ident_file_version);
00222         p_e_type                = disk_to_host(sex, disk64.e_type);
00223         p_e_machine             = disk_to_host(sex, disk64.e_machine);
00224         p_exec_format->set_version(disk_to_host(sex, disk64.e_version));
00225         entry_rva               = disk_to_host(sex, disk64.e_entry);
00226         segtab_rva              = disk_to_host(sex, disk64.e_phoff);
00227         sectab_rva              = disk_to_host(sex, disk64.e_shoff);
00228         p_e_flags               = disk_to_host(sex, disk64.e_flags);
00229         p_e_ehsize              = disk_to_host(sex, disk64.e_ehsize);
00230 
00231         p_e_phnum               = disk_to_host(sex, disk64.e_phnum);
00232         if (p_e_phnum>0) {
00233             p_phextrasz         = disk_to_host(sex, disk64.e_phentsize);
00234             ROSE_ASSERT(p_phextrasz>=sizeof(SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry::Elf64SegmentTableEntry_disk));
00235             p_phextrasz -= sizeof(SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry::Elf64SegmentTableEntry_disk);
00236         } else {
00237             p_phextrasz = 0;
00238         }
00239 
00240         p_e_shnum               = disk_to_host(sex, disk64.e_shnum);
00241         if (p_e_shnum>0) {
00242             p_shextrasz         = disk_to_host(sex, disk64.e_shentsize);
00243             ROSE_ASSERT(p_shextrasz>=sizeof(SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry::Elf64SectionTableEntry_disk));
00244             p_shextrasz -= sizeof(SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry::Elf64SectionTableEntry_disk);
00245         } else {
00246             p_shextrasz = 0;
00247         }
00248 
00249         p_e_shstrndx            = disk_to_host(sex, disk64.e_shstrndx);
00250     } else {
00251         throw FormatError("invalid ELF header file class");
00252     }
00253     
00254     /* Magic number. disk32 and disk64 have header bytes at same offset */
00255     p_magic.clear();
00256     for (size_t i=0; i<sizeof(disk32.e_ident_magic); i++)
00257         p_magic.push_back(disk32.e_ident_magic[i]);
00258     
00259     /* File format */
00260     p_exec_format->set_family(FAMILY_ELF);
00261     switch (p_e_type) {
00262       case 0:
00263         p_exec_format->set_purpose(PURPOSE_UNSPECIFIED);
00264         break;
00265       case 1:
00266       case 3:
00267         p_exec_format->set_purpose(PURPOSE_LIBRARY);
00268         break;
00269       case 2:
00270         p_exec_format->set_purpose(PURPOSE_EXECUTABLE);
00271         break;
00272       case 4:
00273         p_exec_format->set_purpose(PURPOSE_CORE_DUMP);
00274         break;
00275       default:
00276         if (p_e_type >= 0xff00 && p_e_type <= 0xffff) {
00277             p_exec_format->set_purpose(PURPOSE_PROC_SPECIFIC);
00278         } else {
00279             p_exec_format->set_purpose(PURPOSE_OTHER);
00280         }
00281         break;
00282     }
00283     p_exec_format->set_is_current_version(1 == p_exec_format->get_version());
00284     p_exec_format->set_abi(ABI_UNSPECIFIED);                 /* ELF specifies a target architecture rather than an ABI */
00285     p_exec_format->set_abi_version(0);
00286 
00287     /* Target architecture */
00288     set_isa(machine_to_isa(p_e_machine));
00289 
00290     /* Read the optional section and segment tables and the sections to which they point. An empty section or segment table is
00291      * treated as if it doesn't exist. This seems to be compatible with the loader since the 45-bit "tiny" ELF executable
00292      * stores a zero in the e_shnum member and a completely invalid value in the e_shoff member. */
00293     if (sectab_rva>0 && get_e_shnum()>0) {
00294         SgAsmElfSectionTable *tab = new SgAsmElfSectionTable(this);
00295         tab->set_offset(sectab_rva.get_rva());
00296         tab->parse();
00297     }
00298     if (segtab_rva>0 && get_e_phnum()>0) {
00299         SgAsmElfSegmentTable *tab = new SgAsmElfSegmentTable(this);
00300         tab->set_offset(segtab_rva.get_rva());
00301         tab->parse();
00302     }
00303     
00304     /* Associate the entry point with a particular section. */
00305     entry_rva.bind(this);
00306     add_entry_rva(entry_rva);
00307     
00308     return this;
00309 }
00310 
00314 uint64_t
00315 SgAsmElfFileHeader::max_page_size()
00316 {
00317     /* FIXME:
00318      *    System V max page size is 4k.
00319      *    IA32 is 4k
00320      *    x86_64 is 2MB
00321      * Other systems may vary! */
00322     return 4*1024;
00323 }
00324 
00326 SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList
00327 SgAsmElfFileHeader::get_sectab_sections()
00328 {
00329     SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList retval;
00330     SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList sections = get_sections()->get_sections();
00331     for (size_t i=0; i<sections.size(); i++) {
00332         SgAsmElfSection *elfsec = dynamic_cast<SgAsmElfSection*>(sections[i]);
00333         if (elfsec && elfsec->get_section_entry()!=NULL)
00334             retval.push_back(elfsec);
00335     }
00336     return retval;
00337 }
00338 
00340 SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList
00341 SgAsmElfFileHeader::get_segtab_sections()
00342 {
00343     SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList retval;
00344     SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList sections = get_sections()->get_sections();
00345     for (size_t i=0; i<sections.size(); i++) {
00346         SgAsmElfSection *elfsec = dynamic_cast<SgAsmElfSection*>(sections[i]);
00347         if (elfsec && elfsec->get_segment_entry()!=NULL)
00348             retval.push_back(elfsec);
00349     }
00350     return retval;
00351 }
00352 
00354 void *
00355 SgAsmElfFileHeader::encode(ByteOrder sex, Elf32FileHeader_disk *disk) const
00356 {
00357     ROSE_ASSERT(p_magic.size() == NELMTS(disk->e_ident_magic));
00358     for (size_t i=0; i<NELMTS(disk->e_ident_magic); i++)
00359         disk->e_ident_magic[i] = p_magic[i];
00360     host_to_disk(sex, p_e_ident_file_class, &(disk->e_ident_file_class));
00361     host_to_disk(sex, p_e_ident_data_encoding, &(disk->e_ident_data_encoding));
00362     host_to_disk(sex, p_e_ident_file_version, &(disk->e_ident_file_version));
00363     ROSE_ASSERT(p_e_ident_padding.size() == NELMTS(disk->e_ident_padding));
00364     for (size_t i=0; i<NELMTS(disk->e_ident_padding); i++)
00365         disk->e_ident_padding[i] = p_e_ident_padding[i];
00366     host_to_disk(sex, p_e_type, &(disk->e_type));
00367     host_to_disk(sex, p_e_machine, &(disk->e_machine));
00368     host_to_disk(sex, p_exec_format->get_version(), &(disk->e_version));
00369     host_to_disk(sex, get_entry_rva(), &(disk->e_entry));
00370     if (get_segment_table()) {
00371         host_to_disk(sex, get_segment_table()->get_offset(), &(disk->e_phoff));
00372     } else {
00373         host_to_disk(sex, 0, &(disk->e_phoff));
00374     }
00375     if (get_section_table()) {
00376         host_to_disk(sex, get_section_table()->get_offset(), &(disk->e_shoff));
00377     } else {
00378         host_to_disk(sex, 0, &(disk->e_shoff));
00379     }
00380     host_to_disk(sex, p_e_flags,               &(disk->e_flags));
00381     host_to_disk(sex, p_e_ehsize,              &(disk->e_ehsize));
00382 
00383     if (p_e_phnum>0) {
00384         host_to_disk(sex, p_phextrasz+sizeof(SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry::Elf32SegmentTableEntry_disk), &(disk->e_phentsize));
00385     } else {
00386         host_to_disk(sex, 0, &(disk->e_phentsize));
00387     }
00388     if (p_e_shnum>0) {
00389         host_to_disk(sex, p_shextrasz+sizeof(SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry::Elf32SectionTableEntry_disk), &(disk->e_shentsize));
00390     } else {
00391         host_to_disk(sex, 0, &(disk->e_shentsize));
00392     }
00393     host_to_disk(sex, p_e_phnum,               &(disk->e_phnum));
00394     host_to_disk(sex, p_e_shnum,               &(disk->e_shnum));
00395     host_to_disk(sex, p_e_shstrndx,            &(disk->e_shstrndx));
00396 
00397     return disk;
00398 }
00399 void *
00400 SgAsmElfFileHeader::encode(ByteOrder sex, Elf64FileHeader_disk *disk) const
00401 {
00402     ROSE_ASSERT(p_magic.size() == NELMTS(disk->e_ident_magic));
00403     for (size_t i=0; i < NELMTS(disk->e_ident_magic); i++)
00404         disk->e_ident_magic[i] = p_magic[i];
00405     host_to_disk(sex, p_e_ident_file_class, &(disk->e_ident_file_class));
00406     host_to_disk(sex, p_e_ident_data_encoding, &(disk->e_ident_data_encoding));
00407     host_to_disk(sex, p_e_ident_file_version,&(disk->e_ident_file_version));
00408     ROSE_ASSERT(p_e_ident_padding.size() == NELMTS(disk->e_ident_padding));
00409     for (size_t i=0; i<NELMTS(disk->e_ident_padding); i++)
00410         disk->e_ident_padding[i] = p_e_ident_padding[i];
00411     host_to_disk(sex, p_e_type, &(disk->e_type));
00412     host_to_disk(sex, p_e_machine, &(disk->e_machine));
00413     host_to_disk(sex, p_exec_format->get_version(), &(disk->e_version));
00414     host_to_disk(sex, get_entry_rva(),         &(disk->e_entry));
00415     if (get_segment_table()) {
00416         host_to_disk(sex, get_segment_table()->get_offset(), &(disk->e_phoff));
00417     } else {
00418         host_to_disk(sex, 0, &(disk->e_phoff));
00419     }
00420     if (get_section_table()) {
00421         host_to_disk(sex, get_section_table()->get_offset(), &(disk->e_shoff));
00422     } else {
00423         host_to_disk(sex, 0, &(disk->e_shoff));
00424     }
00425     host_to_disk(sex, p_e_flags,               &(disk->e_flags));
00426     host_to_disk(sex, p_e_ehsize,              &(disk->e_ehsize));
00427     host_to_disk(sex, p_phextrasz+sizeof(SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry::Elf64SegmentTableEntry_disk), &(disk->e_phentsize));
00428     host_to_disk(sex, p_e_phnum,               &(disk->e_phnum));
00429     host_to_disk(sex, p_shextrasz+sizeof(SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry::Elf64SectionTableEntry_disk), &(disk->e_shentsize));
00430     host_to_disk(sex, p_e_shnum,               &(disk->e_shnum));
00431     host_to_disk(sex, p_e_shstrndx,            &(disk->e_shstrndx));
00432 
00433     return disk;
00434 }
00435 
00437 bool
00438 SgAsmElfFileHeader::reallocate()
00439 {
00440     /* Reallocate superclass. This also calls reallocate() for all the sections associated with this ELF File Header. */
00441     bool reallocated = SgAsmGenericHeader::reallocate();
00442 
00443     /* Resize header based on current word size */
00444     rose_addr_t need;
00445     if (4==get_word_size()) {
00446         need = sizeof(Elf32FileHeader_disk);
00447     } else if (8==get_word_size()) {
00448         need = sizeof(Elf64FileHeader_disk);
00449     } else {
00450         throw FormatError("unsupported ELF word size");
00451     }
00452     if (need < get_size()) {
00453         if (is_mapped()) {
00454             ROSE_ASSERT(get_mapped_size()==get_size());
00455             set_mapped_size(need);
00456         }
00457         set_size(need);
00458         reallocated = true;
00459     } else if (need > get_size()) {
00460         get_file()->shift_extend(this, 0, need-get_size(), SgAsmGenericFile::ADDRSP_ALL, SgAsmGenericFile::ELASTIC_HOLE);
00461         reallocated = true;
00462     }
00463 
00464     /* Update ELF-specific file class data member from generic data. */
00465     switch(get_word_size()) {
00466       case 4:
00467         p_e_ident_file_class = 1;
00468         break;
00469       case 8:
00470         p_e_ident_file_class = 2;
00471         break;
00472       default:
00473         ROSE_ASSERT(!"invalid word size");
00474         break;
00475     }
00476 
00477     /* Byte order. According to the spec, valid values are 1 (little-endian) and 2 (big-endian). However, we've seen cases
00478      * where a value of zero is used to indicate "native" order (loader assumes words are in the order of the machine on which
00479      * the loader is running, and the ROSE ELF parser determines the order by looking at other fields in the header). Any
00480      * original value other than 1 or 2 will be written to the new output; otherwise we choose 1 or 2 based on the currently
00481      * defined byte order. */
00482     if (p_e_ident_data_encoding==1 || p_e_ident_data_encoding==2) {
00483         p_e_ident_data_encoding = ORDER_LSB==get_sex() ? 1 : 2;
00484     }
00485 
00486     /* Update ELF-specific file type from generic data. */
00487     switch (p_exec_format->get_purpose()) {
00488       case PURPOSE_UNSPECIFIED:
00489       case PURPOSE_PROC_SPECIFIC:
00490       case PURPOSE_OS_SPECIFIC:
00491       case PURPOSE_OTHER:
00492         /* keep as is */
00493         break;
00494       case PURPOSE_LIBRARY:
00495         if (p_e_type==1 || p_e_type==3) {
00496             /* keep as is */
00497         } else {
00498             p_e_type = 1;
00499         }
00500         break;
00501       case PURPOSE_EXECUTABLE:
00502         p_e_type = 2;
00503         break;
00504       case PURPOSE_CORE_DUMP:
00505         p_e_type = 4;
00506     }
00507 
00508     /* Update ELF machine type. */
00509     p_e_machine = isa_to_machine(get_isa());
00510 
00511     /* The ELF header stores its own size */
00512     p_e_ehsize = get_size();
00513 
00514     return reallocated;
00515 }
00516 
00518 void
00519 SgAsmElfFileHeader::unparse(std::ostream &f) const
00520 {
00521     /* Write unreferenced areas back to the file before anything else. */
00522     unparse_holes(f);
00523 
00524     /* Write the ELF segment table and segments first since they generally overlap with more specific things which may have
00525      * been modified when walking the AST. (We generally don't modify segments, just the more specific sections.) */
00526     if (p_segment_table) {
00527         ROSE_ASSERT(p_segment_table->get_header()==this);
00528         p_segment_table->unparse(f);
00529     }
00530 
00531     /* Write the ELF section table and, indirectly, the sections themselves. */
00532     if (p_section_table) {
00533         ROSE_ASSERT(p_section_table->get_header()==this);
00534         p_section_table->unparse(f);
00535     }
00536     
00537     /* Encode and write the ELF file header */
00538     Elf32FileHeader_disk disk32;
00539     Elf64FileHeader_disk disk64;
00540     void *disk = NULL;
00541     size_t struct_size = 0;
00542     if (4 == get_word_size()) {
00543         disk = encode(get_sex(), &disk32);
00544         struct_size = sizeof(disk32);
00545     } else if (8 == get_word_size()) {
00546         disk = encode(get_sex(), &disk64);
00547         struct_size = sizeof(disk64);
00548     } else {
00549         ROSE_ASSERT(!"unsupported word size");
00550     }
00551     write(f, 0, struct_size, disk);
00552 }
00553 
00555 void
00556 SgAsmElfFileHeader::dump(FILE *f, const char *prefix, ssize_t idx) const
00557 {
00558     char p[4096];
00559     if (idx>=0) {
00560         sprintf(p, "%sElfFileHeader[%zd].", prefix, idx);
00561     } else {
00562         sprintf(p, "%sElfFileHeader.", prefix);
00563     }
00564     int w = std::max(1, DUMP_FIELD_WIDTH-(int)strlen(p));
00565 
00566     SgAsmGenericHeader::dump(f, p, -1);
00567     const char *class_s = 1==p_e_ident_file_class ? " (32-bit)" :
00568                           2==p_e_ident_file_class ? " (64-bit)" : "";
00569     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %u%s\n",                           p, w, "e_ident_file_class",     p_e_ident_file_class, class_s);
00570     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %u\n",                             p, w, "e_ident_file_version",   p_e_ident_file_version);
00571     for (size_t i=0; i < p_e_ident_padding.size(); i++)
00572         fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = [%zu] %u\n",                   p, w, "e_ident_padding",     i, p_e_ident_padding[i]);
00573     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %lu\n",                            p, w, "e_type",                 p_e_type);
00574     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %lu\n",                            p, w, "e_machine",              p_e_machine);
00575     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08lx\n",                        p, w, "e_flags",                p_e_flags);
00576     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08lx (%lu) bytes\n",            p, w, "e_ehsize",               p_e_ehsize, p_e_ehsize);
00577     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08lx (%lu) bytes\n",            p, w, "phextrasz",              p_phextrasz, p_phextrasz);
00578     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %lu\n",                            p, w, "e_phnum",                p_e_phnum);
00579     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08lx (%lu) bytes\n",            p, w, "shextrasz",              p_shextrasz, p_shextrasz);
00580     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %lu\n",                            p, w, "e_shnum",                p_e_shnum);
00581     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %lu\n",                            p, w, "e_shstrndx",             p_e_shstrndx);
00582     if (p_section_table) {
00583         fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = [%d] \"%s\"\n",                p, w, "section_table",
00584                 p_section_table->get_id(), p_section_table->get_name()->get_string(true).c_str());
00585     } else {
00586         fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = none\n",                       p, w, "section_table");
00587     }
00588     if (p_segment_table) {
00589         fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = [%d] \"%s\"\n",                p, w, "segment_table",
00590                 p_segment_table->get_id(), p_segment_table->get_name()->get_string(true).c_str());
00591     } else {
00592         fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = none\n",                       p, w, "segment_table");
00593     }
00594 
00595     if (variantT() == V_SgAsmElfFileHeader) //unless a base class
00596         hexdump(f, 0, std::string(p)+"data at ", p_data);
00597 }
